page.title: 15OLDER RESIDENTS REMEMBER 3
page.content:
In the old days the Battery was used as an isolation hospital for the periodic outbreaks of Scarlet Fever, Diptheria, T.B. and even Typhoid ! During these outbreaks water had to be drawn from a special well in Cats Row.
Mrs Vassie remembered the colourful appearance of the Sirdar - General Wingate and his retinue, sheltering under a table from the first Zeppelin raid; Mrs Graham remembered meeting Mrs Pankhurst the famous suffragette, helping to dress her hair.
All felt that changes had been both good and ill, but both women felt glad that they grew up before the Wars rather than in our modern society.
